title: Hewlet
author: Hewlet
content: My country people una Weldon ohI say make I ask this question because e done de my mind since and although I de assume the answer to am, i say make I get legit answers from my snr men here.Na about the ban on bitcoin by our government.I want ask, what if the police or all those uniform men check my phone for road come see say I de into bitcoin, e de possible say them g reason my matter?  I de ask this question because sometimes I go de very comfortable de check out stuff for the forum for road and e go just come my mind say as police take de worry street boys and e come be say de done ban bitcoin, say de fit just harass or arrest me one day oh.Abeg make una help a brother.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Regarding the cryptocurrency ban in Nigeria, there's no written law stating that citizens are not to be caught using Bitcoin, nor has any law been passed stating that citizens caught using Bitcoin should be penalized. That's to say, if any Nigerian arm force catches you with Bitcoin on your phone, there is no law that warrants them penalizing you. The cryptocurrency ban case in Nigeria is that there should be no bank transaction relating to cryptocurrency; otherwise,  your bank account will be blocked. But, OP, do you know that Bitcoin is your private property? And you should not go about flaunting your Bitcoin asset in public. Even cryptocurrency traders don't trade while they are walking on the road, so the question is: what are you checking in your Bitcoin wallet on the road?There's a saying that "prevention is better than cure". If you know you are doing something that can cause complications for you, taking the best precautions is a wise practice.Have a nice day.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: There is no constitution that states that Bitcoin is banned in Nigeria. The CBN only prohibited banks and other financial institutions in the country to stop trading on bitcoin. But however, wisdom is profitable to direct. You know how our security operatives behave so you need to be smart and sharp to avoid any thing that would attract them to you. Avoid operating of phones in the public places if it has to do with bitcoin or this platform. If it Is a necessity, then locate the nearest secured spot to attend to your matters otherwise you will end up getting yourself into trouble because this olokpa men dem no get joy o. Dem ready to collect any collectables wey come their way and we know say Na festive season be this so you gat be careful.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Hewlet on December 08, 2023, 03:57:32 PMNa about the ban on bitcoin by our government.I want ask, what if the police or all those uniform men check my phone for road come see say I de into bitcoin, e de possible say them g reason my matter?  I de ask this question because sometimes I go de very comfortable de check out stuff for the forum for road and e go just come my mind say as police take de worry street boys and e come be say de done ban bitcoin, say de fit just harass or arrest me one day oh.Abeg make una help a brother.Bitcoin is not banned in Nigeria unless it happened today and I'm not aware of it, hence it will be nice you share the link to any article or news release to confirm this. I recall that it was Buhari's administration that  made some policies that did not favour Bitcoin. They were practically closing the accounts of people that transact in Bitcoin and placing restrictions on some. However, the new administration of Tinubu did follow that direction and have even lifted all restrictions placed on crypto related accounts by the previous administration.  Consequently,  Nigeria is a Bitcoin and cryptocurrency friendly country as of today,  hence the growing interest in Bitcoin in various quarters of the country.

So you see, it's allowed to deal with Bitcoin in Nigeria but still, you must be so dem carful because of scammer.The only thing that can make police go detain you is only if you are trying to scam people if their coins, but as long as you are not a scammer, I don't think you will be arrested for using Bitcoin or promoting Bitcoin.

comments.body: Quote from: Hewlet on December 08, 2023, 03:57:32 PMNa about the ban on bitcoin by our government.I want ask, what if the police or all those uniform men check my phone for road come see say I de into bitcoin, e de possible say them g reason my matter?  I de ask this question because sometimes I go de very comfortable de check out stuff for the forum for road and e go just come my mind say as police take de worry street boys and e come be say de done ban bitcoin, say de fit just harass or arrest me one day oh.Abeg make una help a brother.There is no ban on BTC — CBN only stopped banks from facilitating crypto transactions but corrupt police officers have turned that old memo into an avenue to extort money from anyone that indulges iin bitcoin and crypto.My advice? Ensure that anything related to bitcoin and crypto isn't available at a glance on your phone or devices. Once caught by these corrupt officers, it would be your words against theirs. In my experience (I have had an encounter with them), it's probably best not to give them a reason to look further.If you live in an area when such officers can't access or are not allowed to, then you should be good to go. Otherwise just stick to the good 'ol prevention is better than cure practice.

comments.author: Mayor of ogba
comments.body: Quote from: Hewlet on December 08, 2023, 03:57:32 PMNa about the ban on bitcoin by our government.I want ask, what if the police or all those uniform men check my phone for road come see say I de into bitcoin, e de possible say them g reason my matter?  Op, Bitcoin no dey banned for our Naija, the Buhari administration and CBN just placed a ban on our local banks not to carrying out Bitcoin payments. QuoteI de ask this question because sometimes I go de very comfortable de check out stuff for the forum for road and e go just come my mind say as police take de worry street boys and e come be say de done ban bitcoin, say de fit just harass or arrest me one day oh.Op, if police checked your phone come see your Bitcoin wallet or Trust wallet you dey for trouble if you no fit defend yourself well. Police go open your Bitcoin wallet or Trust wallet to know whether you have received Bitcoin before, and if they see Bitcoin transaction for your wallet they go ask you how you carry to get the Bitcoin, and if you no fit explain yourself well, na money you go used bail yourself that day. If you dey travel or comot go outside dey always freeze your Bitcoin wallet or Trust wallet for your phone so that if the police check your phone they no go see anything for your phone to avoid problem.
